verses.text: 差遣十二使徒耶穌召齊十二門徒，給他們能力、權柄，制伏一切鬼魔，醫治各樣的疾病，

words.note: Often used in formal or biblical contexts.
Lit. 'sent disciple/messenger'.
Lit. 'door follower' or 'apprentice at the gate'.
Lit. 'handle of power', signifying control.
Often used in contexts of bringing someone/something under control.
Often used together to emphasize evil supernatural beings.

verses.text: 差遣他們去宣講 神的國和醫治病人，

words.note: Often used in formal or biblical contexts.
Refers specifically to public speaking of a message.
Refers to the divine being.
Here, specifically 'Kingdom of God'.

verses.text: 對他們說：「不要帶著甚麼上路，不要帶手杖，不要帶口袋，不要帶食物，不要帶銀錢，也不要帶兩件衣服。

words.note: Common in ancient contexts for travel.
Here refers to a traveler's bag for provisions.
Refers to currency in the form of silver coins.

verses.text: 無論進哪一家，就住在那裡，直到離開。
凡不接待你們的，你們離開那城的時候，當把腳上的灰塵跺下去，作為反對他們的表示。」

words.note: Often used to generalize, meaning 'whoever' or 'whatever'.
Expresses obligation or necessity.
Implies a forceful action to remove something downwards and away.

verses.text: 於是他們就出去，走遍各鄉，傳講福音，到處醫治病人。

words.note: Connects cause/reason to result
Commonly used for preaching the gospel
Lit. 'blessed news'

verses.text: 希律的困惑分封王希律聽見所發生的一切事，猶豫不定，因為有人說：「約翰從死人中復活了。」

words.note: A ruler of a quarter of a region
Indicates the following verb's object
Idiomatic expression for indecision

verses.text: 又有人說：「以利亞顯現了。」還有人說：「古時的一位先知復活了。」

words.note: Polite measure word for people
Lit. 'one who knows first'

verses.text: 希律說：「約翰已經斬頭了，但這是誰，我怎麼會聽到他這些事呢？」就設法要見他。

words.note: Verb-object compound, specific to execution
Expresses possibility or likelihood
Softens the question or implies 'what about...?'

verses.text: 給五千人吃飽的神蹟使徒們回來，把所作的事報告耶穌。他帶著他們，悄悄地退往伯賽大城去。

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciples' + plural
Introduces object of verb, emphasizing action
Indicates the following verb's object
Repetitive for emphasis, 'de' suffix marks adverb
Functions as a directional complement here

verses.text: 群眾知道了，也跟了去。他接待他們，向他們講論 神的國，醫好需要醫治的人。

words.note: Often used for expounding scripture.
Refers to God in the Bible.

verses.text: 天將晚的時候，十二門徒來到他跟前，說：「請解散眾人，好讓他們往周圍的田舍村莊，去找地方住，找東西吃，因為我們這裡是曠野。」

words.note: Idiomatic, lit. 'east west'.

verses.text: 他說：「你們給他們吃吧！」他們說：「我們所有的，不過是五個餅兩條魚，除非去為這些人另買食物。」

words.note: Forms a nominalizer with the following verb.

verses.text: 原來男人就約有五千。他對門徒說：「叫他們一組一組地坐下，每組約五十人。」

words.note: Repetition means 'group by group'.
Links an adjective/phrase to a verb.

verses.text: 門徒就照他的話，叫眾人坐下。
耶穌拿起這五個餅，兩條魚，望著天，祝謝了，擘開遞給門徒，擺在眾人面前。

words.note: Specifically for giving thanks to God.
Often used for breaking bread in a ritualistic or significant manner.

verses.text: 他們都吃飽了，把剩下的零碎拾起來，裝滿了十二個籃子。
彼得承認耶穌是基督有一次耶穌獨自祈禱的時候，只有門徒和他在一起。他問他們：「人說我是誰？」

words.note: Transliteration of 'Christos', meaning 'Anointed One'.

verses.text: 他們回答：「有人說是施洗的約翰，有人說是以利亞，還有人說是古時的一位先知復活了。」

words.note: Lit. 'John who baptizes'.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.

verses.text: 他又問他們：「你們說我是誰？」彼得回答：「是 神的基督！」

words.note: The raised character indicates reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.
Transliteration of 'Christos', meaning 'Anointed One'.

verses.text: 耶穌預言受難及復活耶穌鄭重地囑咐他們，不要把這事告訴人。

words.note: Refers to Christ's suffering and death.

verses.text: 又說：「人子必須受許多苦，被長老、祭司長，和經學家棄絕、殺害，第三日復活。」

words.note: A title Jesus often used for himself.
Refers to religious or community leaders.

verses.text: 耶穌又對眾人說：「如果有人願意跟從我，就當捨己，天天背起他的十字架來跟從我。

words.note: Lit. 'ten-character frame', referring to the shape of the cross.

verses.text: 凡是想救自己生命的，必喪掉生命；但為我犧牲自己生命的，必救了生命。
人若賺得全世界，卻喪失自己，或賠上自己，有甚麼好處呢？
凡是把我和我的道當作可恥的，人子在他與父並聖天使的榮耀裡降臨的時候，也必把他當作可恥的。

words.note: Refers to Jesus' teachings or message.
A title Jesus often used for himself.
Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 我實在告訴你們，站在這裡的，有人在沒有嘗過死味以前必定要看見 神的國。」

words.note: The preceding space often indicates reverence in Bible texts.
Refers to the Kingdom of God/Heaven.

verses.text: 在山上改變形象說了這些話以後約有八天，耶穌帶著彼得、約翰和雅各，上山去禱告。
正禱告的時候，他的面貌就改變了，衣服潔白發光。
忽然有兩個人和他談話，就是摩西和以利亞。
他們在榮光裡顯現，談論他去世的事，就是他在耶路撒冷將要完成的。

words.note: Often refers to divine or heavenly glory.
Polite term for 'die'.
Indicates future action.

verses.text: 彼得和同伴都在打盹。醒過來之後，就看見他的榮光，並與他站在一起的那兩個人。

words.note: Often refers to divine or heavenly glory.

verses.text: 二人正要離開他的時候，彼得對耶穌說：「主啊，我們在這裡真好！我們可以搭三個帳棚，一個為你，一個為摩西，一個為以利亞。」他根本不知道自己在說甚麼。

words.note: Indicates an action is imminent.
Often capitalized when referring to God/Jesus.
Refers to a temporary dwelling or tabernacle.
Used to emphasize 'not at all'.

verses.text: 他說這話的時候，有一片雲彩籠罩他們，他們入了雲彩，門徒就害怕起來。

words.note: Refers to a student or follower of a master/teacher.
Indicates the beginning of an action or upward movement.

verses.text: 有聲音從雲彩裡出來，說：「這是我的兒子，我所揀選的（「這是我的兒子，我所揀選的」有些抄本作「這是我的愛子」），你們要聽從他！」

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase referring to 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 聲音過了，只見耶穌獨自在那裡。在那些日子，門徒保持緘默，不把所看見的告訴任何人。

words.note: More formal/literary than 安靜 (ānjìng).

verses.text: 治好癲癇病的小孩第二天，他們下了山，有一大群人迎面而來。
在人群中有一個人喊叫說：「老師，求你憐憫我的兒子，因為他是我的獨生子。

words.note: Used as a respectful address for Jesus, like 'Master'.
A formal and religious term for compassion.

verses.text: 你看，污靈一抓住他，他就忽然喊叫，並且抽瘋，口吐白沫；污靈又折磨糟踐他，不肯放過他。

words.note: Used with 就 (jiù) to mean 'as soon as... then...'
Indicates a firm grasp or holding.
Implies treating something with contempt, damaging it.

verses.text: 我求過你的門徒，把他趕出去，他們卻辦不到。」

words.note: Indicates a past experience.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「唉！這不信又乖謬的世代啊！我跟你們在一起，忍受你們，要到幾時呢？把你兒子帶到這裡來吧！」

words.note: An exclamation of sorrow or regret.
Contextually refers to spiritual unbelief.
Describes moral deviation or error, often used in biblical context.
Often carries a moral or spiritual sense in the Bible.

verses.text: 那孩子正走過來的時候，污鬼把他摔倒，使他重重地抽瘋。耶穌斥責那污靈，把孩子醫好，交給他父親。

words.note: Often used for spiritual authority rebuking evil.
Commonly used for divine healing in scripture.

verses.text: 眾人都驚奇 神的大能。眾人還在希奇耶穌所作的這一切時，他對門徒說：

words.note: Frequently refers to God's omnipotence.
Similar to 驚奇, but often implies more awe or curiosity.
Indicates the object of the verb that follows.

verses.text: 第二次預言受難及復活「你們要把這些話存在心裡：人子將要被交在人的手裡。」

words.note: Refers to Christ's passion or suffering.
Figurative for memory or understanding.
A title Jesus used for himself, emphasizing his humanity and messianic role.
Figurative for being under someone's power or control.

verses.text: 門徒不明白這話，因為這話的意思是隱藏的，不讓他們明白，他們也不敢問。

words.note: Often used in scripture for truths hidden from human understanding.

verses.text: 門徒爭論誰最大後來，門徒起了意見，爭論誰是最大的。

words.note: Refers to followers of a master or religion.
Refers to followers of a master or religion.
Used here with 意見 (yìjiàn) meaning 'to have an opinion'.

verses.text: 耶穌看出他們的心意，就領了一個小孩子來，叫他站在自己旁邊，
對他們說：「凡因我的名接待這小孩子的，就是接待我；凡接待我的，就是接待那差我來的。誰是你們中間最小的，那人就是最大的。」

words.note: Often used in formal or biblical contexts to mean 'whoever' or 'everyone who'.
In biblical context, 'in my name' refers to authority or representation.
Often implies showing hospitality to guests.
Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who...'
Often implies showing hospitality to guests.
Often used in formal or biblical contexts to mean 'whoever' or 'everyone who'.
Often implies showing hospitality to guests.
Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who...'
Often implies showing hospitality to guests.
Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the one who...'
Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the least one.'
Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the greatest one.'

verses.text: 約翰說：「主，我們看見有一個人奉你的名趕鬼，就禁止他，因為他不和我們一起跟從你。」

words.note: A respectful address for God or Jesus.
Used in formal or religious contexts, often meaning 'by command of'.
In biblical context, 'in your name' implies authority or power.
In a religious context, implies following a spiritual leader or teaching.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「不要禁止他，因為不反對你們的，就是贊成你們的。」

words.note: 不要 (bùyào) means 'don't' or 'must not'.
Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who...'
Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who...'

verses.text: 撒瑪利亞人不接待主耶穌被接上升的日子快到了，他就決意向耶路撒冷去，

words.note: Title for God or Jesus in Christianity.
Refers to the ascension.
More formal than '決定'.

verses.text: 並且差遣使者走在前頭；他們去了，進入撒瑪利亞的一個村莊，要為他預備。

words.note: More formal than '派'.

verses.text: 那裡的人不接待他，因為他面向著耶路撒冷走。
他的門徒雅各、約翰看見了，就說：「主啊，你要我們吩咐火從天降下來，燒滅他們嗎？」

words.note: Lit. 'gate/school follower'.
Title for God or Jesus in Christianity.
Indicates exclamation or appeal.
More formal and definitive than '燒掉'.

verses.text: 耶穌就轉過身來，責備他們，
然後他們就往別的村莊去了。
要求跟從耶穌他們走路的時候，有一個人對他說：「你無論往哪裡去，我都要跟從你！」
耶穌說：「狐狸有洞，天空的飛鳥有窩，人子卻沒有棲身的地方。」

words.note: A messianic title for Jesus.

verses.text: 他對另一個人說：「你跟從我吧！」那人說：「主啊，請准我先回去安葬我的父親吧。」
耶穌說：「讓死人去埋葬他們的死人，你應該去傳揚 神的國。」

words.note: The space is a reverent space, common in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to the Kingdom of God.

verses.text: 又有一個人說：「主，我要跟從你，但容我先回去，向家人道別。」

words.note: Refers to Jesus as Lord.

words.definition: want to, will, be going to

verses.text: 耶穌說：「手扶著犁向後看的，不適合進 神的國。」

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase: 'those who look'.
The empty space before 神 is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
